title: Nice beach but be careful
text: North Narbeen Beach Beautiful beach and very long so it is ideal for long walks. On both sides of the beach there are saltwater pools. Pay attention to the signs as there are dangerous currents and it is always full of Portuguese man o' war jellyfish.

title: Endless views of the ocean
text: North Narbeen Beach Beautiful beach and great sunset views, and if you are lucky you can spot whales during mating season, endless views of the ocean.

title: Beautiful beach, lagoon, walks and rock pool
text: North Narbeen Beach Narrabeen beach has so much to offer. Including exposed rocks during low tide, a lagoon that is located next to the rock pool. Long sandy beach to go on a nice long walk or bi-centennial coastal walk up the coast to Warriewood beach and further.

title: A Mecca for surfers
text:
North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen has long been renowned for having some of the best, most consistent waves on the East Coast and along the way the area has produced some of Australia's most famous surfers. From the lookout on the point at the northern end of the beach you can see the current crop ply their skills. (Just look for the crowd of onlookers with cameras.)
If you are not a red-hot surfer North Narrabeen still has plenty to offer. There are very good ocean baths also at the north end that attract families and serious lap swimmers. The beach is also very long, extending several kms to Collaroy Beach in the south. Very good for a long beach walk and there are plenty of uncrowded (though also unpatrolled) sections along the way too.

title: Beautiful beach  ‍♂️‍♀️
text:
North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen beach is nestled bedside Narrabeen lagoon and has a stunning Rockpool and a long sandy beach which is fabulous for surfing . 

Walking around the lagoon is also excellent for all age groups with a dedicated pathway for bicycles and pedestrians. The lagoon also has several beautiful spots for swimming, fishing or canoeing . 

North Narrabeen beach is located on the northern beaches 25km north of the CBD.

title: Lovely Beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Swimming in our oceans with life guards and on North Narrabeen is a gr888t day out at the beach for anyone

title: Perfect place
text: North Narbeen Beach Absolutely beautiful spot. Love the ocean rockpool, which is excellent for recreational or lap swimming. The headland and inlet are fantastic

title: Beautiful Beach for walking or Surfing
text: North Narbeen Beach Fabulous beach, with excellent waves for surfing. Clean and picturesque.  Has a great rock pool for swimming as well, and the lagoon, but this needs to be open to the surf, for optimum water quality.

title: North Narrabeen Surf Life Saving Club. Has a hideaway cafe/restaurant, that is not mentioned in Trip Adviser.
text: North Narbeen Beach With “eat in or alfresco” on the balcony overlooking the surf & sand. My daughters & I had a delicious meal, and great coffee. It is so good we often eat there, . Prices reasonable. Casual dress. So relaxing watching the waves roll in! Hidden gem!

title: Amazing Beach
text: North Narbeen Beach A very nice beach, wasn't busy when we were there but we were told by locals that it does get very busy in Summer. Most public car parking is paid parking and actively monitored by Council.

title: Great beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Maybe I shouldn't tell people as I love this place. Great for taking photos at sunrise or sunset, as you can see both East and West. You can swim in the surf or in the rock pool.

title: breathtaking
text: North Narbeen Beach great beach, was very quiet when I went there, we had a great time. it's a sandy beach with great sunset view

title: Lovely ocean pool
text: North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen Rockpool: this is an ocean pool on a point so it has a good view on three sides. The path from the car park is flat and not too long. The pool bottom is sandy and it has a nice wooden boardwalk where you can leave your stuff. Would be better at high tide with waves crashing all around.

title: Surfs up
text: North Narbeen Beach Like all the Northern Beaches crashing waves and sand. Make sure you swim between the flags there can be a significant sweep.

title: One of the best beaches in Sydney
text: North Narbeen Beach I grew up around here and love this beach, go there most weekends in Summer for a walk and/or a swim

title: North Narra has everything!
text: North Narbeen Beach A beautiful patrolled beach on the Northern Beaches of Sydney. Glorious rockpool for pottering and looking at the lcoal rock life plus for the kids the opening of the Lagoon comes in from the sea and there is a wonderfully safe and clean Lagoon area to swim. Plenty of Cafes are close by and the North Narrabeen Surf Club has a functioning Bar Friday, Saturday and Sunday afternoon/evenings where you can sit on the balcony overlooking the azure beachfront and enjoy a cold one or two. PARADISE!

title: Great beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Love Nth Narrabeen. Never over the top busy with people and huge beach area. Add to that the lake and pool at the northern end and you can’t ask for more.

title: Great at sunrise & Sunset
text:
North Narbeen Beach Enjoy your time at the beach & then enjoy great coffee & food at the local cafe opposite the beach.

Great for an early walk & dip in the ocean.

title: For Experienced Surfers only
text: North Narbeen Beach Great surf spot.  Swell magnetic.  Orangish sand.  Very localised / heavy crew. Intermediate level wave.  Don't bother surfing here unless you're experienced and an expert.  Others won't get waves. Body boarders sre not made welcome. Surfing royalty are out in the line up most good days

title: Narrabeen - Not a good place to visit
text: North Narbeen Beach An very undeveloped area. Internet is still ADSL1 which is very out-of-dated (even using Telstra network). You will find it hard to surf the internet sometimes. Limited shops and cafe, nothing much to do except the beach. Foods in Narrabeen are terrible. Not recommend unless you grew up from bush.

title: Beautiful beach
text: North Narbeen Beach What a fabulous beach with a lake as well (great for younger children). There is surf patrol too so it is safe if you want to go body surfing (or surfing).

title: Great lunch and very good coffee
text:
North Narbeen Beach Been here a couple of times , sometimes for a coffee ,  or breakfast and others for lunch . 

Very friendly team , fresh ingredients, and again great coffee . Location is also one of the nicest hangouts on North Narrabeen

title: North Narrabeen Beach
text:
North Narbeen Beach A slice of heaven on the northern beaches.
The beach is great for surfing with a right to left break from the point.
the beach can be a bit rough for swimming but the lagoon that can be accessed from the road or the beach is just perfict

title: Great location and beach
text: North Narbeen Beach This place is superb all year long. It is more than just a summer destination, and a lot of walking all over the place. The surf can get hectic sometimes so beware. And enjoy!!

title: North Narrabeen Beach
text: North Narbeen Beach One of the longest beaches in Sydney, North Narrabeen is a great place to visit. The Northern End has cafes, is near the caravan park and has a beach pool. It can get rough at times but the lagoon just behind the dunes is a great place for young families when the water mouth is open to the sea. Remember to always swim between the flags.

title: best place on earth.
text: North Narbeen Beach What more can you say about the best beach on earth. when the lake is open and the sun is out where else would you rather be.

title: Classic Northern Beaches destination
text: North Narbeen Beach Good sea water pool if the sea is too rough or you just want a leisurely swim, but a great beach for surfing or just diving through the waves. Good loo with changing facilities, car park about 150 yds from pool, with small cafe nearby. Life guards on duty with flagged areas most of the time, never seen it too busy.

title: A week in Narrabeen
text:
North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen  Narabeen is a great beach , can stroll along the sand there is a park and playground at one end and the rock pool and park at the other 
If you are a surfer it looks good , certainly good for a swim but like all the Northern Beaches swim in the flags and ask the locals for advice on where is best to swim
Quite a few cafes close to the beach 
Just a good beach for lots of activities , parking around the area is both metered and free

title: Three in one.
text: North Narbeen Beach Narrabeen beach offers you three places in one. If you have some small children with you, the Narrabeen lagoon or the rock pool is for you. If you’re a surfer or just prefer the ocean, go to the beach. All the three of them are next to each other.

title: great for sunrise photography
text: North Narbeen Beach stunning ocean bath and beautiful long beach to walk along.classic Australian beach with bright sand and curling waves..depending on weather off course. lots of walking to be done.

title: Great spot with cafe. Parking is a hassle
text:
North Narbeen Beach As with all good beaches in Sydney parking is the main hassle. 
Helps if you have a Warringah parking permit so you can park for a couple of hours for free. It is one of the better beaches for finding a parking spot. On a hot day get there before 9/10am to find a spot. 
Life saving club at Narrabeen beach is great for refreshments such as smoothies and coffee or a light bite to eat. 
Well patrolled along the beach. Not as crowded as Manly or Bondi.

title: Lovely beach with many places to explore
text:
North Narbeen Beach Beach had much to offer and less crowded compared to Manly. Parking could be expensive for $8 per hour and $28 for a day. 
Walk along beach to north or south; or dip in the rock pool.

title: Love the rockpool
text: North Narbeen Beach Great spot! The rockpool is a perfect oasis to enjoy a swim. Lights come on around sunset as well so it is delightful into the evening

title: Great most of the year round, the pool gets dirty in peak summer
text: North Narbeen Beach Recently renovated lakeside picnic area  just up from the main car park makes it a great place to have a swim and chill out all day. A good place to take a beach walk from Narrabeen to Collaroy. In summer the ocean pool can get dirty and doesn't flush often enough

title: Wonderful Beach
text: North Narbeen Beach This was my first visit and I was very impressed! Lovely views and golden sand! We visited in the winter and water was warm when we paddled our feet. We spoke to a local surfer and he commented how warm the water was although the temperature out of the water was a lot colder. I'll certainly be back in the summer!

title: Great local beach with a long sea frontage
text:
North Narbeen Beach Right near the Narrabeen lakes entry the beach is nice and long with plenty of room for everyone. 
Top of the beach (Northern End) has the small channel leading to the lakes. This creates a large shallow area for families especially young kids to play safely and enjoy the water without the waves. The beach front has lots of access and good swimming as well as surfing . 
Clean sand, attracts a lot of people while having space for everyone and close by access to shops for takeaway and general groceries to stay happy and entertained on or near the beach.

title: Nice Quiet Beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Northern beaches are quite nice.  This once was not over crowed, peaceful and I enjoyed the lovely views.

title: Great beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Nice beach - I especially enjoyed the rock pools to the north end. Beware of the inlet - it was roaring along.

title: Great beach
text: North Narbeen Beach This is one of the traditional beaches of Australia. BE WARNED, Rips are frequent on this beach so be careful and always, always swim between the flags

title: A beach for everybody
text:
North Narbeen Beach The beach is beautiful and ideal for surfing and to the north the small, tidal creek is an ideal, safe area for children to play. It is the connection between the Narrabeen Lakes and the ocean and at low tide the water flows seawards leaving little islands which at high tide are covered in water.
Also to the north there are two tidal swimming pools, both of them quite shallow but ideal for safe swimming. There are also showers and public toilets. There is also a walkway, up stairs on the Coastal path from which there are great views down the coast to Long Reef.

title: Legendary surfing beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Location of the best and most consistent surfing beaches in Sydney if not nsw, given a mention in Beach Boys classic Surfin USA . Patrolled beach , parking a problem on sunny days , ok for kids with an adult

title: Great beach for surfing or swimming
text: North Narbeen Beach Known locally as an excellent surfing beach, North Narrabeen beach is also a great place for families as the beach is patrolled and there is a large ocean swimming pool with dedicated swimmers lanes as well as a pool ranging from shallow to deeper to suit all ages and abilities. The are also toilets, showers and a cafe to hand. Parking is limited but there is street parking in the area.  Feel like some exercise? You can walk up Narrabeen Headland to Turimetta, Warriewood or Mona Vale Headlands - all the way up the coast to Palm Beach for the serious trekkers. Great for an hour or spend the day

title: Lovely beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Visited here on saturday 12th November. It was a bit rough due to the surf but lovely beach, also near lagoon where we were and also had ocean baths. Beautiful.

title: Fantastic Location
text: North Narbeen Beach Beautiful beach, very quiet with cracking waves for surfing.  So good it was mentioned in the Beach Boys Surfin' USA song.  There's a great swimming pool at the end of the beach near to the brilliant surf club.  The Hit Cafe inside serves tremendous food.  Don't bother going anywhere else.  It's tremendous value for money and the quality is great.  The staff are very polite and helpful.  It really added to our time at the beach.  The kids loved their time on the beach and the surf club, happy kids means happy parents!

title: " relaxing day out at the beach"
text: North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen is our most favourite place to visit. We have been going there for many years with our children as they were growing up and now they visit with their families. Narrabeen is such a relaxing place for the whole family with lots to do. The rock pool is quite popular but I really enjoy a walk along the uncrowded beach.

title: Just gorgeous
text: North Narbeen Beach Where else can you walk along a beach and be able to enjoy a good degree of solitude and only half an hour from the centre of Sydney.  During the week from North Narrabeen to Collaroy I'm lucky to bump into a couple of people - on the weekends in warmer weather it can be a different story.  At the North Narrabeen end, there's two rock pools, the lagoon and the surf to choose from for a swim.  If you feel more energetic you can walk up the stairs then through the bush to Turrimetta Beach or if you feel lazy and hungry, there's a café on the surf club roof with great coffee and by the looks of it - pretty good food!

title: great uncrowded beach
text: North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen Beach is great for surfers and anybody just looking for an uncrowded beach to lounge on or swim in,theres a great sea pool to swim in at the northern end of the beach and a beach club and facilities near by.  The lake entrance is a good place for kids to spash around in a safely.

title: Another beautiful northern beach
text:
North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen Beach is another example of a beautiful Sydney northern beach.
Plenty to do, simply walk the beach, surf or enjoy the rock pool.

title: Great clubhouse
text: North Narbeen Beach Great family beach, the clubhouse Friday night is good fun as well. The lake empties into the sea at the northern end and means good fishing and great wave catching for kids when tide running in, totally safe.

title: Morning walk
text: North Narbeen Beach Great walk from the nearby caravan park. There are two swimming pools, that are used a lot by the locals. God walk alone the beach, and watch the surfers.

title: At the end of the Lagoon
text: North Narbeen Beach Another of the beautiful Northern Beaches. This beach is bounded on the north by the headland and also the inlet of the Narrabeen lakes. From there it stretches south down towards Colloroy.

title: Loved this beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Sydney, your beaches rock! This was such beautiful place to swim and body surf. It was great when the tide went out for the kids but beware of the rips and currents if you are not swimming in the flags. The ocean pools are so lovely and the rock pools around it kept the kids entertained for hours.

title: Great Walk
text:
North Narbeen Beach I walked from the Sands Hotel to North Narrabeen, great exercise regime. Such a beautiful location, quiet and relaxing.
make sure your have your bathers. hat, water and sunscreen.
Great for walkers of any experience.

title: love
text: North Narbeen Beach Narrabeen beach is really nice for swimming and surfing and its just a generally lovely place I love it

title: The beach is amazing and so clean and relaxing.
text: North Narbeen Beach We have been to quite a few beaches in the world and this one is one of the nicest. It was groomed and clean and not crowded at all. Simply beautiful.

title: Awesome Aussie Beach
text:
North Narbeen Beach Walking from North Narrabeen to Collary is just Heavan. The Narrabeen beaches are awesome Aussie surfbeach and a must for every travler to experience.  Come on a warm sunny day and the ocean sound and cleanliness of the water will be an experience you wont forget. Feels like paradise yet so close to Sydney
Better than Bondi or Manly beaches although don't expect a lot of choices for cafes or eateries.
Its the beach your coming for!

title: Better then Bondi
text:
North Narbeen Beach First time to this beautiful beach with friends who live local.Plenty of parking & space on the beach.
Everyone was just enjoying themselves on the first day of 2016.
I definitely will  be going again.

title: One of the best surfing beaches in Sydney
text:
North Narbeen Beach Situated on the Northern Beaches of Sydney, North Narrabeen sits at the entrance of the Narrabeen Lake, a tidal lake which is generally opened to the sea.
The area offers parks, playgrounds, cafe's and restaurants all in close proximity.

The Surf Life Saving Club has a café and bar and you can sit out on the deck and enjoy coffee or a beer.
The Big 4 Caravan park is close by offering cabins and campsite - very popular throughout summer as it fronts the lake.

title: Scenic but also a top surfing competition beach
text: North Narbeen Beach I've lived nearby to this beach for nearly 40 years.  Major (meaning international) surf competitions and at least one rock concert have been held here but its fun just to walk to the rock pool or go for a swim in the ocean.  If you like beach photos dawn is the best time and there are pelicans on the Narrabeen Lagoon where it empties into the ocean which are especially good photo subjects.  Its a great family outing place.

title: The Best beach on Northern Beaches
text: North Narbeen Beach Beautiful beach for a swimming and very famous for surfing. The oceanic pool it's one of the biggest on the area and try to watch the sunrise from there, it's just a life time experience.

title: Wonderful sight and wonderful walking
text: North Narbeen Beach Wonderful for strong swimmers too - I played safe and used the lagoon and rock pools nearby - wonderful - see adjoining review

title: Good for kids
text:
North Narbeen Beach Great spot with the ocean pool and inlet for the kids to use if needed. 

Downside is that the parking can be atrocious on a popular day.

title: Great walk
text: North Narbeen Beach Beautiful beach and ocean baths can walk along beach forever all the way to Manly so the sign says, a,so trail walks,very picturesque. And can have stop over at surf club for refreshments.

title: Relaxed and watched waves, did a lot of eating and walking.
text: North Narbeen Beach Such a lovely place some excellent places to eat and relax. Would love to go back and try more places to eat. Beach was so clean and also had lifeguards if you wanted to swim safely.

title: great beach
text: North Narbeen Beach beautiful beach, great walking along the sand, beach stretches along for miles, it is  a very friendly place, people say hello as you walk pass, great place to visit.

title: Great Experience
text: North Narbeen Beach We had great weather to visit the beach. Plenty of space to walk, swim and laze around without feeling too crowded.

title: lovely !
text:
North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen is apart of Narrabeen Beach &  includes Birdwood Park and Narrabeen Lagoon located on the Northern Peninsula. If wanting a secluded private beach North Narrabeen has plenty of space & is not crowded like Manly or Dee Why. 

 Narrabeen Lakes, which is a very popular spot for families and water sports, such as rowing, fishing, boating, windsurfing, canoeing, sailing, waterskiing, and kayaking. This is a great beach for learners. The Lakes are situated around numerous reserves, which also contain Narrabeen Caravan Park, which is a Sydney icon. 

There are some excellent walking tracks around the lagoon and lakes. South Narrabeen Beach is located at the end of Clarke Street; it has a surf club with facilities. Narrabeen Beach also has a surf club with plenty of cafes and restaurants available.

North Narrabeen is famous for being one of the best surf breaks in the world, many world championship competitions are held here regularly. The reason the surf is so good is because of “Shark Alley” a deep channel and with the lagoon emptying into the sea creates a sandbar, which then produces extraordinary waves.  

By transport catch the 182 L87, L88 or L90 from Wynyard or the bus 155 or 157 from Manly. 

Plenty of facilities are available including change rooms, toilets, showers, & parking .

title: Clean surf beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Beautiful clean and well-maintained surf beach, perfect for surf board riding or swimming.  There is a cafe at the beach which is no doubt popular in the summer.

title: Beautiful
text: North Narbeen Beach Beautifully clean with soft sand. Being on a business trip I only managed a few early morning walks but it was stunning.

title: Pristine
text: North Narbeen Beach I love going to this beach. It is still very pristine and beautiful. Not so crowded as Manly or Dee why. It is worth a visit if you are seeking some alone time or some romantic time with your partner.

title: Crashing waves, beach-side pool or a gentle lagoon - your choice
text: North Narbeen Beach I just love North Narrabeen with its deep yellow sand falling down to a good surf beach.  The swimming pool at the end,  nestled under the cliffs and then the lagoon which is great for kids and adults alike. Its got the lot.

title: Fabulous Spot
text: North Narbeen Beach Great location, great beaches, excellent restaurants, great transport link to city and Manly. Plenty of good cafes, access to beach is plentiful, the lakes are on your doorstep as is good cycling routes and golf courses.

title: An amazing stretch of beach
text:
North Narbeen Beach Long, clean, uncrowded, world class surf beach and one of the best in Sydney.  Lots of places to park, multiple surf clubs with eateries and a kid safe lagoon entrance to the northern end of the beach.

Walk, surf, swim, run, kite surf or just sit.  Narrabeen is good for all.  Its a quintessential Aussie beach icon.

title: Great Beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Love the Beach so close to the motel and great surf! Highly recommend any time! It be back next year

title: best surf out
text:
North Narbeen Beach Love the surf.
Family friendly areas as well such as the little lake area.
Short walk to food and transport :)

title: North Narrabeen Beach
text:
North Narbeen Beach Large expanse of beach with a surf club.
Wooden boardwalks and seating at some access points.
Good cafes nearby.

title: Surf Paradise
text: North Narbeen Beach My S-I-L surfs here every morning, has done for 10 years and rates it his favourite break. All along this stretch of beach good surf is found. We often sit on the cliff tops and watch him and others. There is a seawater pool here too which is very popular. Lots of surf fisherfolk when the tides are right . Good beach top cafes too and we love the cheap and cheerful one opposite the Surf Club. Upmarket dining too next to the main car park . Beautiful area with a mix of young surfers and older more affluent residents all having fun on the beach.

title: Surf beach and calm lagoon for the kids
text: North Narbeen Beach Great surf beach where Narrabeen Lakes enters the ocean. Ocean pool and walks up onto the headland give great views along the coast. The lagoon side of the dunes provides a calm and shallow beach for littlies or those not confident in the surf. Also a few cafes and restaurants for refreshment close to the car park.

title: a stunningly beautiful beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Narrabeen lagoon enters the sea here and creates a surfers dream break. The large rockpool is a swimmer's delight.

title: Scenic
text: North Narbeen Beach Peaceful...tranquil setting...one could get out..mediate, take photos re relive memories of a nice drive out to Narrabeen

title: views great
text: North Narbeen Beach Loved walking along the beach and taking photographs from the headlands.  But sand is soft and walking hard work

title: Love this place
text: North Narbeen Beach Childhood dreams bought me back here. Just love this place. Give the busy Bondi and Manly a miss and visit this place. If you want to leave the crowds behind and make the most of a good surf, then this beach is it. Scored 10 out of 10 with my lovely bride and bought back great memories.

title: Excellent/Quiet beach. Good place for entire family.
text: North Narbeen Beach Spent some time here swimming and building sand structures. This place has an amazing atmosphere that's good for the entire family.

title: Good northern suburbs beach
text: North Narbeen Beach Lacks the popularity (and crowds) of say Manly and Bondi.  A good beach for relaxing and good for families.

title: Family time
text: North Narbeen Beach Seeing family again after a long absence lots of new friends and new family for first time too much traffic noise  and too much rush around Xmas time

title: PEACEFUL
text:
North Narbeen Beach It was a Peaceful relaxing weekend. Fun on the beach and rocks.
It was just a short walk across the road to the beach........

title: FUN!
text: North Narbeen Beach North Narrabeen Beach is great, with the rapids, the pool, the lagoon and the surf to choose from everyone was happy! Whether floating down the rapids or cathcing a wave in the surf everyone was happy

title: North Narrabeen Beach
text:
North Narbeen Beach Gorgeous beach !  Fantastic surfing early on Sunday mornings. 
Never too crowded. Beautiful crescent shape.

title: North Narrabeen - Wonderful - I Live 2 Blocks Away
text:
North Narbeen Beach This is a great camping area nearby as well as a really easy bus to the City.  If I were to come to Sydney as a tourist from the country looking for a baeach holiday, I would pick this.  

Would also recommend for overseas visitors looking for a great spot to experience Sydney up a little on the Norther Beaches area.

title: North Narrabeen Beach
text: North Narbeen Beach This beach use to be my favourite beach mainly because it is a quiet beach not as popular as other beaches in sydney. But still a safe lovely each to go to.

title: Great spot on the Nthn Beaches
text: North Narbeen Beach If your into surfing this place is Epic. So many famous surfers have hailed from here. It is very quiet and a nice part of the Nth Shore of Sydney.

title: Don't miss the Ocean Pool!
text: North Narbeen Beach If you want to have a beautiful swim, take memorable photos, explore some rock pools visit the Ocean Pool at North Narra. Take caution if crossing the lake entrance as there are oysters which yield a nasty cut if not careful. Nice and quiet in winter, but busy in Summer. Council cleans the pool weekly so it is always lovely for some laps or a frolic.

title: The best of both worlds!!
text: North Narbeen Beach Whether you like the motion of the ocean or the stillness of the lake, North Narrabeen has it all. A popular family destination that caters for surfing, camping, fishing, sunbaking, swimming and cuisine which makes this location a truly unique spot in Sydney.

title: Take time to have a look around
text: North Narbeen Beach Narrabeen and North Narrabeen are approx. 40 minutes North of the CBD. You can get there by bus or car. Narrabeen sits between the beach and the shores of a lake/lagoon. At first glance it doesn't seem much but get out and walk around. The lake has a shared path all the way around that is great for an easy ride or long walk. At present (May) the lake has a family of black swans visiting. And has huge numbers of ducks and other sea bird life around and in it. You can walk over the classic concrete bridge and under some pelicans that seem to sit on the light poles, there all day. Under the bridge, people fish (I saw a guy catch a huge flathead from there) and there are swallow nests built into the foundations. There are heaps of small cafes spread through out Narrabeen that do great coffee, The Deli on Waterloo was lovely, Waterloo is the name of the street it is on. Most of the people seem friendly and bike riding is an easy way to get around here. There are farmers markets on during the day on Fridays behind the caravan park. Narrabeen has an amazing headland that  looks out to Long Reef and has a great walking track  around it. And of course it has a good surf beach and a well maintained rock pool. The caravan park is rated as one of the best in Australia but it does have a price to go with it. Just North of Narrabeen is Warriewood, which also has great cafes and a lovely little beach and headland walks. The sunrises are beautiful and the water is still warmish.

title: Narrabeen Markets, 3rd Sunday of every month!
text:
North Narbeen Beach This a great Market at North Narrabeen right on the lake, with a full range of different stores, from clothes to handcrafts, plants, fruit and vege and yummy food stores as well. There also is this great store there that takes moulds of babies hands and feet they then compile it into a nice frame with a photo, really good gift idea.
Worth a wander and look if you are around the Northern Beaches!

title: Ozone -
text: North Narbeen Beach Traditional holiday destination at the caravan park for many country families during the summer Christmas break.  Safe, clean tidal lake for swimming with children; surf side perfect for catching a wave. Cafes; bike riding; patrolled surf beach; ocean pool; hire a canoe; the perfect summer destination 40 minutes approx from the centre of Sydney.
